sanskrit_verse:
इष्टिं वैश्वानरीं नित्यं निर्वपेदब्दपर्यये ।
कॢप्तानां पशुसोमानां निष्कृत्यर्थमसम्भवे ॥ ११.२७॥
transliteration:
iṣṭiṃ vaiśvānarīṃ nityaṃ nirvapedabdaparyaye |
kḷptānāṃ paśusomānāṃ niṣkṛtyarthamasambhave || 11.27||
sph_interpretive_translation: When the annual sacrificial obligations involving animals and soma are unfeasible, one must perpetually perform the Vaisvanara sacrifice for the purification and restoration of dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from continuity of dharmic function, not form.
Causation is aligned with conscious capacity to sustain order.
Capacity-based responsibility supersedes literal compliance in exigency.
Restoration logic operates through substitution of equivalent spiritual force.
Consciousness alignment occurs via sustained intent even when material means fail.
executable_legal_axioms: IF ritual capacity is obstructed THEN substitute with equivalent consciousness-based action.
IF material offerings are unattainable THEN perpetual internalized worship SHALL maintain dharmic balance.
IF societal collapse prevents collective sacrifice THEN individual Vaisvanara observance becomes mandatory.
IF karmic debt remains due to omission THEN continuous alignment with Agni restores causal equilibrium.
supreme_court_application: In cases where institutional or national dharmic practices become impossible due to external collapse, the Supreme Court shall recognize the validity of individual perpetual Vaisvanara worship as a constitutional replacement for collective rituals, ensuring continuity of lawful spiritual governance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that dharma does not depend on visible performance but on sustaining intention. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that failure in external form necessitates internal compensation. Proportional responsibility lies in maintaining equivalence of energy. Non-punitive reality is upheld by substituting action without inflicting consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate daily Agnihotra protocol to replace lost communal offerings.
Assign personal mantra repetition correlated to original sacrificial frequency.
Engage in weekly svadhyaya cycles to restore lost ritual consciousness.
Implement community-wide prana pratishtha of symbolic fire altars.
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law executes pure Dharma: when outer forms fall away, inner fire sustains all worlds. There is no punishment—only completion. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
